title: Are Tik Tok videos copyrighted? - Quora

response.answer_text: Under US law, yes. Anything and everything you create is yours, no questions asked. TikTok is allowed to use your videos for commercials and such because of their EULA, but aside from that, you own any videos you create. Now, I know what you’re thinking: if my video goes viral, I’m going to take down every person that copies me! Don’t. There is nothing you’d gain, aside from a reputation for being a crappy person. You wouldn’t cash in on a bigger reputation because more people visit you directly, and you wouldn’t earn more money for that reason (does TikTok even have ad revenue? Ah, whatever). Let the internet do its thing if you don’t want to be branded the worlds biggest wet blanket.

I think it would be worth your while to read the TOS on TikTok. The TOS prohibit you from uploading any infringing material, and demand that you make available any other material you upload, offering a free license, in effect, for users to download your material. See the TOS for more details. TikTok itself is protected by the “safe harbor” provision of OCILLA under DMCA (Digital Milleniun Copyrught Act). If they get an NOI (notice of inringement) on a video, they take it down to avoid liability. You can decide whether it’s worth trying to restore and fight for it. JA - No legal advice is intended.

Of course. Just like YouTube videos, TikTok videos are copyrighted. “TikTok respects the intellectual property rights of others, and we expect you to do the same. TikTok’s Terms of Service and Community Guidelines do not allow posting, sharing, or sending any content that violates or infringes someone else’s copyrights, trademarks, or other intellectual property rights.” - from Intellectual Property Policy | TikTok

No, but If you want then download all tik tok video then upload Youtube. But this you upload on youtube, it’s already on youtube then you get the copyright. Otherwise, you don’t get a copyright on Tik Tok. Example:

There is copyright on all audio, video, photographs, and text longer than a few sentences. Copyright protections are automatic and immediate when you create something. That copyright lasts at least 70 years, usually much longer, with the duration being slightly different between different countries.
